meta_description: Bringing art and people together, since 1973. Admission is always free.
hours_text:
* [Homepage](https://museum.cornell.edu)
  * [About](https://museum.cornell.edu/about/)

# Visit

  * [Homepage](https://museum.cornell.edu)
  * [About](https://museum.cornell.edu/about/)

##  Bringing Art  
and People   
_Together_

### Planning Your Visit

**Winter closure****:** The Museum is currently closed to the public (December 22, 2025–January 19, 2026).

**Winter hours (beginning January 20):** Tuesday–Friday, 10AM–5PM; Saturday–Sunday, 12–4PM. Admission for everyone is always free.

Special hours are posted here during major holidays and [Cornell break periods](https://registrar.cornell.edu/academic-calendar/2025-2026).

**PLEASE NOTE:** The elevator in our main building has been experiencing intermittent issues and has been frequently taken out of service until its repair can be scheduled. All floors are accessible by stairs. _(Updated November 20, 2025)_

Nonflash photography is permitted for personal use, except where noted. Flash photography, video, and tripods are not permitted for visitors. Any food, drink / water bottles, backpacks, large bags, and umbrellas must be left in the lobby where you entered. Small lockers are available for free use.

## Directions

**Driving:** From Route 79, turn on Stewart Avenue. Turn right at University Avenue and go up the hill to the Museum. Turn right into our metered parking lot.

[Plan your visit to Cornell](http://www.cornell.edu/visit/) for complete directions on getting to campus, or find directions using the street ad...

accessibility_text:
#  Web Accessibility Assistance 

Cornell University is committed to making our websites accessible to everyone, including individuals with disabilities. To report a problem or to request an accommodation to access online materials, information, resources, and/or services, please contact [ur-accessibility@cornell.edu](mailto:ur-accessibility@cornell.edu). In your message, include the website address or URL and the specific problems you have encountered. You will receive a reply as soon as possible.

collections_text:
* [Homepage](https://museum.cornell.edu)
  * [Homepage](https://museum.cornell.edu/)

# Homepage

## The Johnson Museum of Art

Closed for winter break December 22–January 19

[Hours & Directions](/about/visit/)

[ ](/about/visit/)

The Museum is located near the Arts Quad at the top of Libe Slope.

## Connect Your Class with the Museum

We help design and lead class sessions in our permanent collection galleries and classrooms

[More for Faculty](/learn/faculty-and-instructors/)

[ ](/learn/faculty-and-instructors/)

Students study a portfolio in the Richard Sukenik ’59 Teaching Gallery.

## A World of Art for All Ages

Teach with us at the Museum, in your classroom, or at home

[Teach with Us](/learn/teachers/)

[ ](/learn/teachers/)

We offer gallery and studio instruction for pre-K through Grade 12.

## Your Support Makes All the Difference

Gifts to our annual fund make what we do possible.

[Make Your Gift](https://museum.cornell.edu/support/annual-fund/)

[ ](https://museum.cornell.edu/support/annual-fund/)

The annual fund connects all visitors to original works of art.

**01** Maureen Gruben, Stitching My Landscape (detail), 2017
